question:
Q1
If you were to consider your life in general these days, how happy or unhappy would you say you are, on the whole...

Q2
All things considered, how satisfied are you with your relationships with family members?

Q3
Do you think it is wrong or not wrong if a MARRIED person has sexual relations with someone OTHER than his or her husband or wife, is it...

Q4
And what about sexual relations between two adults of the same sex, is it...

Q5
Do you PERSONALLY think it is wrong or not wrong for a woman to have an abortion if the family has a very low income and cannot afford any more
children.

Q6
Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
A husband's job is to earn money; a wife's job is to look aer the home and family.

Q7
How much confidence do you have in...
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q7a
[Parliament]
[use national legislature, e.g. U.S. Congress]

Q7
How much confidence do you have in...
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q7b
Business and industry

Q7
How much confidence do you have in...
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q7c
Churches and religious organizations

Q7
How much confidence do you have in...
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q7d
Courts and the legal system

Q7
How much confidence do you have in...
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q7e

Q8
How much do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Religious leaders should not try to influence how people vote in elections.

Q9
Please consider the following statements and tell me whether you agree or disagree.
Q9a
We trust too much in science and not enough in religious faith.

Q9
Please consider the following statements and tell me whether you agree or disagree.
Q9b
Looking around the world, religions bring more conflict than peace.

Q9
Please consider the following statements and tell me whether you agree or disagree.
Q9c
People with very strong religious beliefs are oen too intolerant of others.

Q10
Do you think that churches and religious organizations in this country have too much power or too little power?

answer.3: About the right amount of power

question:
Q11
People have different religions and different religious views. Would you accept a person from a different religion or with a very different religious
view from yours marrying a relative of yours?

Q12
There are some people whose views are considered extreme by the majority. Consider religious extremists, that is people who believe that their
religion is the only true faith and all other religions should be considered as enemies. Do you think such people should be allowed to...
(PLEASE TICK ONE BOX ON EACH LINE)
Q12a
Hold public meetings to express their views?

Q12
There are some people whose views are considered extreme by the majority. Consider religious extremists, that is people who believe that their
religion is the only true faith and all other religions should be considered as enemies. Do you think such people should be allowed to...
(PLEASE TICK ONE BOX ON EACH LINE)
Q12b
Publish their views on the Internet or social media?

Q13
Please indicate which statement below comes closest to expressing what you believe about God.

answer.2: Don't know whether there is a God and no way to find out
answer.3: Don't believe in a personal God, but in a Higher Power
answer.4: Find myself believing in God sometimes, but not at others
answer.5: While I have doubts, I feel that I do believe in God
answer.6: I know God really exists and have no doubts about it

question:
Q14
Which best describes your beliefs about God?

answer.1: I don't believe in God now and I never have
answer.2: I don't believe in God now, but I used to
answer.3: I believe in God now, but I didn't use to
answer.4: I believe in God now and I always have

Q15c

Do you believe in...

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16a
There is a God who concerns Himself with every human being personally.

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16b
There is little that people can do to change the course of their lives.

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16c
To me, life is meaningful only because God exists.

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16d
In my opinion, life does not serve any purpose.

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16e
Life is only meaningful if you provide the meaning yourself.

Q16
Do you agree or disagree with the following?
(PLEASE CIRCLE A NUMBER)
Q16f
I have my own way of connecting with God without churches or religious services.

Q17
In your opinion, does your religion treat men and women equally, treat men better than women, or treat women better than men?

answer.1: I don't belong to or follow any religion

question:
Religion respondent raised in: compressed groups of religions.
Derivation:
This variable is derived from Q.20a (detailed religious denominations).
When you were a child, how often did your mother attend religious services?

answer.3: About once or twice a year

IL.question: When you were a child, how often did (your mother/ your father/ you when you were 11 or 12) go to the synagogue, mosque etc.?

question: When you were a child, how often did your father attend religious services?

answer.3: About once or twice a year

IL.question: When you were a child, how often did (your mother/ your father/ you when you were 11 or 12) go to the synagogue, mosque etc.?

question: And what about when you were around 11 or 12, how often did you attend religious services then?

answer.3: About once or twice a year

IL.question: When you were a child, how often did (your mother/ your father/ you when you were 11 or 12) go to the synagogue, mosque etc.?

question:
Now thinking about the present...
Q24a
About how often do you pray?

answer.3: About once or twice a year

question: How often do you take part in the activities or organizations of a church or place of worship other than attending services?

answer.3: About once or twice a year

US.9: Several times a week/ Once a day/ Several times a day

IL.question: How often do you participate in activities in the synagogue, mosque, church other than attending prayers in place of worship?

question: During the last 12 months, have you read or listened to the reading of any holy scripture such as the Bible, Buddhist sutra, Koran, Sruti, Torah, or other religious scripture, not counting any reading that happened during a worship service?

IS.question: During the last months, ... (and not 'During the last 12 months, ...').

question: For religious reasons do you have in your home a shrine, altar, or a religious object on display such as a [COUNTRY-SPECIFIC LIST icon, retablo, mezuzah, menorah, or crucifix]?

How often do you visit a holy place for religious reasons such as going to [COUNTRY-SPECIFIC shrine/ temple/ church/ mosque]?
Please do NOT count attending regular religious services at your usual place of worship, if you have one.

answer.3: About once or twice a year
answer.5: About once a month or more

question: Would you describe yourself as...

CZ.question: There is a major problem while translating the word 'religious' into Czech as there is no direct equivalent in Czech language. Therefore, the word 'duchovní' was used, which is close to the word 'spiritual' in English.

question: What best describes you:

answer.1: I follow a religion, I am a spiritual person
answer.2: I follow a religion, I am not a spiritual person
answer.3: I don't follow a religion, I am a spiritual person
answer.4: I don't follow a religion, I am not a spiritual person

question:
Do you agree or disagree that practicing a religion helps people to…
Q31a
Make friends?

Do you agree or disagree that practicing a religion helps people to…
Q31b
Gain comfort in times of trouble or sorrow?

Do you agree or disagree with the following statement?
Religions are usually a barrier to equality between women and men.

Q33a
Governments should not interfere with the attempts of any religion to spread its faith.

Do you agree or disagree with the following statements?
Q33b
All things considered, people belonging to different religions cannot get along with each other when living close together.

Do you agree or disagree with each of the following?
Q34a
In [COUNTRY], religion represents the past and not the future.
